tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.ref: the round sea of cast metal
tn.text: This is a very large metal tank.
This is the top edge of the container.
This is the distance around the outside of a circle.
AT: "ten per cubit"
This is the back quarter of the body of an animal with four feet. See the same word used (only other reference in the Old Testament See: [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:07:25|1 Kings 7:25]])
(See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.ref: its brim was forged like the brim of a cup, like a lily blossom
tn.text: AT: The brim had a soft, curved edge" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
(See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
This is a shallow bowl used for washing.
(See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
bowls that were used in the house of God for sprinkling the altar
like capitals** - The upper part of a pillar is called a capital. AT: "bowl-shaped tops" or "bowl-shaped upper parts" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
This refers to the decorative carving or markings on the upper part of the pillars.
AT: "the bowls"
This is a large decorative washing container.
other tools or objects used for the altar
Bronze that the workmen polished for it to reflect light.
(See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Thus Solomon made all these vessels
tn.text: Solomon did not personally make the vessels, but he commanded them to be made.

tn.ref: the weight of the bronze could not be known
tn.text: AT: "the amount of bronze was very great" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
Solomon's workers made things at his command.
all of the bowls and tools that were used in the house of God.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2ch:02:04|2:4]].
These would have trimmed the wicks of the lamps.
